CFBSr 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Compute Mel-filterbank energy features from audio

    get_mel.Rd

    This function computes Mel-filterbank energy features from audio signals.

    get_mel(
  chopped_dir,
  winlen = 0.025,
  winstep = 0.01,
  nfft = 512,
  nfilt = 26,
  lowfreq = 0,
  highfreq = NULL
)

    Arguments

    chopped_dir

    Directory of the individual sound files. Typically created with get_word_sound_files.

    winlen

    The length of the analysis window in seconds. Default is 0.025.

    winstep

    The step between successive windows in seconds. Default is 0.01.

    nfft

    The FFT size. Default is 512.

    nfilt

    The number of filters in the filterbank. Default is 26.

    lowfreq

    Lowest band edge of Mel filters. In Hz, default is 0.

    highfreq

    Highest band edge of Mel filters. In Hz, default is samplerate/2.

    Value

    A list object.

    References

    Uwe Ligges, Sebastian Krey, Olaf Mersmann, and Sarah Schnackenberg (2023). tuneR: Analysis of Music and Speech. URL: https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=tuneR

    James Lyons, Darren Yow-Bang Wang, Gianluca, Hanan Shteingart, Erik Mavrinac, Yash Gaurkar, Watcharapol Watcharawisetkul, Sam Birch, Lu Zhihe, Josef Hölzl, Janis Lesinskis, Henrik Almér, Chris Lord, & Adam Stark. (2020). jameslyons/python_speech_features: release v0.6.1 (0.6.1). Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.3607820

    Author

    Dominic Schmitz

    Examples

    if (FALSE) mel_features <- get_mel(chopped_dir = "/chopped")
